alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 8:26AM EDT until August 01 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Johnson County in northeastern Kentucky... Southern Martin County in northeastern Kentucky... Northeastern Breathitt County in southeastern Kentucky... Floyd County in southeastern Kentucky... Magoffin County in southeastern Kentucky... Northern Pike County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 1030 AM EDT. * At 826 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pikeville, Prestonsburg, Salyersville, Mason, Coal Run Village, Martin, Forest Hills, Allen, Alvin, Emma, Banner, Dwale, Allen City, Ivel, Beaver Junction, Corn Fork Hollow, Lancer, Arkansas, Endicott. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Pike
